perturbation.original_text: 17. Section 12.2 (b) of the Existing Agreement, regarding termination of the Existing Agreement by Columbia, shall be deleted and replaced by the following: "12.2 (b) Columbia shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon [***] notice to Fleet in the event: (i) Fleet fails to maintain its authorizations under Applicable law to manufacture the product, including without limitation those from MHRA; (ii) a Change of Control Event with respect to Fleet occurs; (iii) Fleet cannot supply product at a Competitive Price; or (iv) the Ares Agreement is terminated."
perturbation.changed_text: 17. Section 12.2 (b) of the Existing Agreement, regarding termination of the Existing Agreement by Columbia, shall be deleted and replaced by the following: "12.2 (b) Columbia may consider terminating this Agreement if: (i) Fleet's authorizations under Applicable law to manufacture the product are under review, including those from MHRA; (ii) a potential Change of Control Event with respect to Fleet occurs; (iii) Fleet indicates an inability to supply product at a Competitive Price; or (iv) the Ares Agreement is under negotiation."
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Columbia shall have the right to terminate this Agreement' to 'Columbia may consider terminating this Agreement if' significantly weakens Columbia's termination rights. The original text provided clear termination events, whereas the revised text only allows Columbia to consider termination when certain events arise. This contradicts the purpose of a termination clause, which should provide defined circumstances for ending the agreement. In addition, the original text stated 'Fleet fails to maintain its authorizations', whereas the changed text states 'Fleet's authorizations under Applicable law to manufacture the product are under review'. The original text stated 'Fleet cannot supply product at a Competitive Price', whereas the changed text states 'Fleet indicates an inability to supply product at a Competitive Price'. The original text stated 'the Ares Agreement is terminated', whereas the changed text states 'the Ares Agreement is under negotiation'. All of these contradict the clear termination events, since Fleet's authorization may resume, the Ares Agreement may continue and/or Fleet may eventually offer Competitive Price for the product.
